definition: to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
river/CL:條|条[tiao2],道[dao4]

sentences.english: Don't spout off at the mouth about how the story is dumb.
sentences.chinese: 不要信口開河地評論他的需求是多麼的愚蠢。

sentences.english: The old sailor love to spin yarn about his life at sea.
sentences.chinese: 那老水手愛信口開河地講他的航海生涯。

sentences.english: You lay there on the bed, leaking, and I comforted you.
sentences.chinese: 你躺在牀上，信口開河，我安慰你。

sentences.english: He spoke offhandedly, making it clear I had no say in the matter.
sentences.chinese: 他信口開河，明顯表示這件事我無權發言。

sentences.english: Fritz is loud mouth who can not be trusted with secrets.
sentences.chinese: 費瑞茲是一個信口開河的人，不能把機密告訴他。

sentences.english: She never thinks before she speaks. She just shoots from the hip.
sentences.chinese: 她說話總是不經大腦就信口開河。

sentences.english: He always shoots his mouth off and says things he later regrets.
sentences.chinese: 他總是信口開河，結果盡說些讓自己事後後悔的話。

sentences.english: She had a bad habit of spouting off.
sentences.chinese: 她有個信口開河的壞毛病。

sentences.english: Bones: I hate it when you make paranoia plausible.
sentences.chinese: 你這人偏執起來信口開河的時候還真討厭。

sentences.english: Loose lips really can cause trouble.
sentences.chinese: 信口開河可真能帶來麻煩。
他信口開河地作完了他的演說。

sentences.english: He has a tendency to pop off, unwittingly offending many people.
sentences.chinese: 他有信口開河的毛病，無意中得罪了不少人。

sentences.english: Sorry, I shouldn't have shot from the hip.
sentences.chinese: 對不起，我不該信口開河的。

definition: lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
to exaggerate
to prattle on self-importantly (idiom)
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
complete nonsense (idiom)
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
